summary: Mitchell A. Mars was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll certifications for the committee in October and November 1977, and May 1978. The documents list his name, position, and salary during those periods. The specific role or responsibilities of Mitchell A. Mars within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Mitchell A. Mars' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, suggesting he contributed to the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the exact nature and impact of his contribution are not specified in these payroll documents.
